items.name: smb_instructions
items.content:
How to access shared Windows folder on Android (SMB)\n\n
                
                    
                        Enable File Sharing on Windows\n
                    
                    
                        Open the Control Panel, click Choose HomeGroup and Sharing options under Network
                        and Internet, and click "Change Advanced Sharing Settings," enable the "File and
                        Printer Sharing" feature.\n\n
                    

                    
                        Additional File Sharing settings\n
                    
                    
                        You may also want to configure the other advanced sharing settings here. \n
                        For example, you could enable access to your files without a password if you trust all
                        the devices on your local network. Once file and printer sharing is enabled, you can
                        open File Explorer or Windows Explorer, right-click a folder you want to share, and
                        select Properties. \n
                        Click the Share button and make the folder available on the network.\n\n
                        

                    
                        Make sure both devices are on same Wifi\n
                    
                    
                        This feature makes files available on the local network, so your PC and mobile devices
                        have to be on the same local network. You can\’t access a shared Windows folder
                        over the Internet or when your smartphone is connected to its mobile data — it
                        has to be connected to Wi-Fi.\n\n
                    

                    
                        Find IP Address\n
                    
                    
                        Open Command Prompt. Type \'ipconfig\' and press Enter. Look for Default Gateway
                        under your network adapter for your router\'s IP address. Look for
                        \\\"IPv4 Address\\\" under the same adapter section to find your computer\'s IP
                        address.\n\n
                    

                    Enter details in SMB dialog box\n

items.name: ssh_host_key_verification_prompt
items.content:
The authenticity of host '%1$s' can't be established.

%2$s key fingerprint is %3$s.

Please tap "Yes" to confirm identity; otherwise, please tap "No".

items.name: ssh_authentication_failure_password
items.content: Logon failure: Unable to authenticate with supplied username and password.

items.name: ssh_authentication_failure_key
items.content: Logon failure: Unable to authenticate with supplied username and private key.

items.name: ssh_connect_failed_host_key_changed_title
items.content: WARNING: REMOTE HOST IDENTIFICATION HAS CHANGED!

items.name: ssh_connect_failed_host_key_changed_message
items.content:
IT IS POSSIBLE THAT SOMEONE IS DOING SOMETHING NASTY!

Someone could be eavesdropping on you right now (man-in-the-middle attack)! It is also possible that the host key has just been changed. The fingerprint for the public key sent by the remote host does not match the one stored in Amaze.

Please contact your system administrator or setup a new connection to continue connecting to the server.

items.name: encrypt_option_use_aescrypt_desc
items.content:
AESCrypt is an open source file encryption format based on AES encryption. It is also portable, can be decrypted with AESCrypt programs on other platforms.

AESCrypt website

items.name: encrypt_option_use_azecrypt_desc
items.content: Amaze\'s Encryption Format is also based on AES encryption; but different from AESCrypt format, it can only be decrypted by this device; also you must not uninstall Amaze File Manager from this device nor change the way you lock screen, otherwise you will have no way to recover the encrypted file.

items.name: encrypt_file_must_end_with_aze
items.content: Encrypted files must use \".aze\" as the file extension.

items.name: encrypt_file_must_end_with_aes
items.content: Encrypted files must use \".aes\" as the file extension.

items.name: ssh_connect_failed_host_key_changed_prompt
items.content:
IT IS POSSIBLE THAT SOMEONE IS DOING SOMETHING NASTY!

Someone could be eavesdropping on you right now (man-in-the-middle attack)! It is also possible that the host key has just been changed. The fingerprint for the public key sent by the remote host does not match the one stored in Amaze.

You may proceed with updating host fingerprint or cancel updating SSH connection settings.

items.name: ftp_prompt_accept_first_start_saf_access_title
items.content: Grant SAF access for FTP server

items.name: ftp_prompt_accept_first_start_saf_access
items.content:
Since this is your first run of the FTP server, and you are using the device\'s internal storage as shared folder, please allow Amaze to access the storage using SAF.\n\n

You only need to do this once, until the next time you select a new location for sharing.

items.name: android_data_prompt_saf_access
items.content: Since Android 10, Android had imposed restrictions on certain directories, and they need to access with Storage Access Framework.\n\nPlease allow Amaze to access the directory from the system\'s file manager by tapping \"Allow Access\".

items.name: ftp_preference_saf_filesystem
items.content: Enable this for support for using device external storage on newer Android versions

items.name: ftp_server_fallback_path_reset_prompt
items.content: FTP server shared path had been reset to internal storage as you are switching back to legacy filesystem implementation. Please select a new path using the menu on the top right as necessary.

items.name: ftp_server_reset_notify
items.content: FTP server shared path had been reset to internal storage

items.name: ftp_server_root_unavailable
items.content: You are choosing a path which requires root access. Please enable root explorer in settings if your device is rooted.

items.name: ftp_server_root_filesystem_warning
items.content: You are choosing a path which requires root access, which enables read/write operations in the whole filesystem on your device, and it is dangerous - careless mistakes could brick your device!\n\nAre you sure?

items.name: grant_all_files_permission
items.content:
Since Android 11, Google requests File Managers to request user permission for managing all files on the device. Details here.
        

Amaze File Manager needs this permission too. After pressing "Grant"here, please select Allow access to manage all files option on the next screen.
        

Canceling this dialog will exit the app.
